intro: Argyreia apoensis, commonly known as the sacred lotus of the Philippines, is a flowering plant belonging to the Convolvulaceae family. It is native to Southeast Asia and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink and violet. The plant produces heart-shaped leaves and has a climbing habit, often found in moist, tropical environments. Its flowers are not only ornamental but also hold cultural significance in various indigenous communities. The fruit is a capsule that contains numerous small, black seeds.
